sn46.17:4.1: “Mendicants, when these seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated they lead to going from the near shore to the far shore.
sn46.17:4.3: The awakening-factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and equanimity.
sn46.17:4.5: These seven awakening factors, when developed and cultivated, lead to going from the near shore to the far shore.”
sn46.17:5.2: who cross to the far shore.
sn46.17:6.1: When the teaching is well explained,
sn46.17:6.3: are the ones who will cross over
sn46.17:6.4: the realm of death so very hard to cross.
sn46.17:7.2: an astute person should develop the bright.
sn46.17:7.4: for the seclusion so hard to enjoy,
sn46.17:8.1: you should try to find delight there,
sn46.17:8.3: With no possessions, an astute person
sn46.17:8.4: should cleanse themselves of mental corruptions.
sn46.17:9.1: And those whose minds are rightly developed
sn46.17:9.6: they are extinguished in this world.”
